summary: This is a scheduling order from United States District Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It establishes deadlines for discovery, motions, and sets a trial date of July 12, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this scheduling order is issued.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this scheduling order.

events.title: Court Proceeding
events.description: A proceeding was held where the court set the schedule for the case.

events.title: Initial Discovery Deadline
events.description: Deadline for initial non-electronic discovery, including search warrant applications and subpoena returns.

events.title: Completion of Discovery Deadline
events.description: Deadline for completion of all discovery, including electronic materials.

events.title: Motion Responses Deadline
events.description: Deadline for filing responses to motions.

events.title: Motion Replies Deadline
events.description: Deadline for filing replies to motion responses.

events.title: Trial Date Set
events.description: The trial for the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin.

keyFacts: The document is a scheduling order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
A trial date for the case was set for July 12, 2021.
The order establishes a detailed timeline for discovery and motion practice leading up to the trial.
